intro: Cladanthus, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to survive in dry, sandy soils, and it often grows in rocky or disturbed areas. Cladanthus produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its propagation in harsh environments.
